logic

Class Figure

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Figure
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public abstract class Figure
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class represents the basic structure of a chess figure.
    Author:
    jendrikmuller

      Constructor and Description
      Figure(boolean white)
      Creates a new instance of Figure.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Figure

        public Figure(boolean white)
        Creates a new instance of Figure.
        Parameters:
        white - true if the Figure should be white and false if it should be black

    • Method Detail

      • isWhite

        public boolean isWhite()
        Tells if the Figure is white or not.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the Figure is white and false if it is black

      • isMoved

        public boolean isMoved()
        Tells if the Figure was moved or not.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the Figure was moved

      • setMoved

        public void setMoved(boolean moved)
        Sets the attribute moved.
        Parameters:
        moved - new value of the attribute moved

      • checkEndField

        public boolean checkEndField(Field field)
        Controls of the Figure can be placed on the given Field. This method shouldn't be used for Figures of the type pawn cause of special rulings.
        Parameters:
        field - Field to check
        Returns:
        boolean true if the figure can be placed on the given field and otherwise false

      • legalMove

        public abstract byte legalMove(Move move,
                               Field[][] field)
        Evaluates the given Move and and returns a byte value describing its kind.
        Parameters:
        move - The move to evaluate
        field - A field array describing the current board state.
        Returns:
        byte the value of the byte describes the kind of movement(for example 2 for castling)
